snippet: Black Americans were nearly four times as likely as whites to be arrested for marijuana possession in 2010, but both groups used the drug at similar rates, federal data shows.
abstract: Federal data shows that black Americans were nearly four times as likely as whites to be arrested on charges of marijuana possession in 2010, even though two groups used drug at similar rates; disparity has grown steadily from decade earlier, while public attitudes toward marijuana softened and number of states decriminalized its use; 2011 arrest rates were roughly similar to 2010.
lead_paragraph: Black Americans were nearly four times as likely as whites to be arrested for marijuana possession in 2010, but both groups used the drug at similar rates, federal data shows.

headline.seo: Marijuana Arrests Four Times as Likely for Blacks
headline.main: Blacks Are Singled Out for Marijuana Arrests, Federal Data Suggests
headline.print_headline: Blacks Are Singled Out For Marijuana Arrests, Federal Data Suggests
